name: tastelessly
content:
tastelessly adverb
(LIKELY TO UPSET)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is likely to upset or offend someone: a tastelessly cruel joke
More examplesFewer examplesthe person who tastelessly broadcasts the intimate details of his personal life by talking too loudly on his cellphone A sidebar analysis is headlined, somewhat tastelessly, "An Issue that Won't Die." It would have been better if they'd said nothing rather than boasting tastelessly about our smaller infant mortality figures.'Not even clapped-out old ex-wives?' I quipped - tastelessly, no doubt.
